item.title: Terrorist Attacks in Russia's Dagestan Target Synagogue, Churches, Police
item.description: Russian authorities said the assailants opened fire on houses of worship in Dagestan’s capital of Makhachkala and the city of Derbent.

item.title: Apple Shares Largely Flat Following EU Charges Under New Tech Law
item.description: Apple shares were largely flat in premarket exchanges after the European Union said the iPhone maker’s App Store rules might be in breach of the bloc’s Digital Markets Act.

item.title: German Business Sentiment Declines on Gloomier Outlook
item.description: The Ifo Institute’s business-climate index fell to 88.6 in June, against economists’ expectations it would rise to 89.6,

item.title: Gold Trades Flat; Investors Looking for New Catalysts
item.description: Gold edged higher while base metals were mixed, as traders awaited fresh clues on the path of U.S. inflation and monetary policy.

item.title: French Election Concerns Likely to Lift Dollar, Offseting Potential Weak U.S. Inflation Data
item.description: The dollar has emerged the favored hedge for political uncertainty ahead of elections in France where the far-right National Rally party is expected to make significant gains, ING said.

item.title: Oil Broadly Stable Ahead of U.S. Inflation Data This Week
item.description: Oil prices were broadly stable early in the European session, as traders awaited key U.S. inflation data later in the week for more cues on the path of interest-rate cuts.

item.title: Apple Hit by First Charges Under New European Tech Law
item.description: The charges are the first to be issued under the EU’s Digital Markets Act, which sets out a long list of rules aimed at boosting competition in digital advertising, online search and app ecosystems.

item.title: Paladin Energy Agrees to Buy Fission Uranium
item.description: Australian uranium company Paladin Energy has agreed to buy Canada’s Fission Uranium, aiming to create a globally significant supplier of the nuclear fuel.

item.title: German Bunds Seen Trading Directionless Ahead of Ifo Data
item.description: Bunds were lacking direction as the market awaited German Ifo data at 0800 GMT, which deserves more attention than usual after the surprisingly weak purchasing manager surveys on Friday, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: How 'Healing' Crystals Are Painful to Mine
item.description: A global celebrity-driven craze for quartz has caused a rush to dig in backyards and hillsides in rural South Africa.

item.title: How Ukraine's Naval Drones Turned the Tide in the Battle of the Black Sea
item.description: Unmanned vessels developed in the fight against Russia are part of a revolution in modern warfare.

item.title: Died: Jamie Kellner, 77, helped launch Fox network.
item.description: Died: Jamie Kellner, 77, helped launch Fox network.

item.title: Rep. Matt Gaetz, a sharply conservative figure in the GOP, has been jumping into primary campaigns to attempt to remold the party in his image.
item.description: Rep. Matt Gaetz, a sharply conservative figure in the GOP, has been jumping into primary campaigns to attempt to remold the party in his image.

item.title: A March fire at a German factory that was at first called an accident is now believed to be sabotage in what may be part of a Russian effort to hamper arms exports to Ukraine.
item.description: A March fire at a German factory that was at first called an accident is now believed to be sabotage in what may be part of a Russian effort to hamper arms exports to Ukraine.

item.title: The use of IUDs among U.S. women has risen both because of concerns about new restrictions on abortion and broader insurance coverage for the birth-control method.
item.description: The use of IUDs among U.S. women has risen both because of concerns about new restrictions on abortion and broader insurance coverage for the birth-control method.

item.title: Immigrants are increasingly making their way to suburbs and small cities across the U.S. that aren't prepared to handle them, leading to improvised responses and sometimes generating hostility.
item.description: Immigrants are increasingly making their way to suburbs and small cities across the U.S. that aren’t prepared to handle them, leading to improvised responses and sometimes generating hostility.

item.title: Netanyahu said Israel is close to shifting to a less intense phase of fighting in Gaza, and he opposes re-establishing Israeli civilian settlements there, an ambition of his rightist coalition partners.
item.description: Netanyahu said Israel is close to shifting to a less intense phase of fighting in Gaza, and he opposes re-establishing Israeli civilian settlements there, an ambition of his rightist coalition partners.

item.title: Armed militants attacked two churches, a synagogue and a police station in the Dagestan republic of the North Caucasus in Russia, killing nine people, Russian state media reported.
item.description: Armed militants attacked two churches, a synagogue and a police station in the Dagestan republic of the North Caucasus in Russia, killing nine people, Russian state media reported.

item.title: Counterfeit air bags have been blamed for at least five accidents causing death or serious injury in the past year, as federal regulators and the auto industry try to crack down on the fakes.
item.description: Counterfeit air bags have been blamed for at least five accidents causing death or serious injury in the past year, as federal regulators and the auto industry try to crack down on the fakes.

item.title: UPS is selling its freight-brokerage business, Coyote Logistics, to rival middleman RXO for $1.025 billion.
item.description: UPS is selling its freight-brokerage business, Coyote Logistics, to rival middleman RXO for $1.025 billion.
